thread.title: Top 5 things to do in and around Bolton this weekend
thread.title_full: Top 5 things to do in and around Bolton this weekend

title: Top 5 things to do in and around Bolton this weekend
text:
1 comments 
1. An Enemy of the People, Octagon Theatre , tonight and tomorrow, 7.30pm 
An Enemy of the People is a compelling and gripping play, directed by David Thacker, that explores the conflict between the need to stand up for the truth when faced with the political and economic pressures that drive the agendas of those in power. 
2. Birds of prey display, pop-up market, Victoria Square, Saturday from 10am 
Say hello to a beautiful selection of birds which will be on display in the town centre. 
3. Pride Live, Blind Tiger, Nelson Square, Saturday, 2pm until late 
The all day event in support of the town’s first Pride event, featuring local acts including Purge, Yiyan, Breaking Waves, Holly Jenkinson and Stuck Between Stories. 
4. Buzzcocks, Manchester Academy, Saturday from 7.30pm 
Twenty five years since the Buzzcocks played in Manchester Academy for its opening night, the band, which formed in Bolton, is back to mark the venue's anniversary celebrations. 
5. An Evening of Burlesque, Opera House, Manchester, Saturday, 8pm Share article 
For the very first time ever – the biggest burlesque legends from around the world are united on one stage as Britain’s No1 burlesque show goes global. Includes a performance from Leigh-born jazz starlet Emma Divine. Promoted Stories Top 5 things to do in and around Bolton this weekend Sorry, an error occurred.
